page.title: 02LANDSCAPE IN FRILSHAM
page.content: The land is{undulating.}There are fine far reaching views because of the varying heights of the land and variety of cover. Most fields are under 30 acres and enclosed by hedges. Low ground-71metres-is in the valley of the{River Pang}in the centre of the area rising to 121m at Coombe Wood and Frilsham Common, the site of an ancient beacon. Hawkridge and Coombe Wood in the north are natural woodlands as are those round Boars Hole Farm and Home Farm. High Copse and Birch Farm Woods in the north are commercial plantations. In the centre lies the village of Frilsham. A small patch of heath is registered as a village green round which are grouped the houses. In the countryside around are 7 farms with all their outbuildings. One of 4 large manor type houses,Marlston; is now a school.
